definition: countless as the grains of sand in the Ganges (idiom)
permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: All Buddhas such as these, numberless as Ganges sands.

pinyin: san1 qian1 da4 qian1 shi4 jie4

definition: World Honored One/Revered One of the World (Buddha)
every living being (Buddhism)/the mass of common people
lit. measured in cartloads and gallons/fig. by the barrowload (i.e. lots and lots)/innumerable
Buddha (a person who has attained Buddhahood, or specifically Siddhartha Gautama)
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
great wide world/marvelously diverse world/(Buddhism) cosmos (abbr. for 三千大千世界[san1 qian1 da4 qian1 shi4 jie4])
